title: Focused alacritty windows crash when restarting i3
body:
For bug reports, the following information can help speed up the process. Please
describe the bug that you have found and what you would expect to happen
instead.

### System

OS: Debian 11 stable
Version: 0.12.0-dev (2d619850)
Linux/BSD: X11, i3 and picom

### Logs

Crashes: STDERR, STDOUT
Font/Terminal size: 

```

```

Keyboard and bindings: `alacritty --print-events`

So I recently cloned the repo and after i set everything up, it works until I restart i3. After that, it just blacked out like in this picture:
![Screenshot_2022-11-30_23-10-49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118409646/204857719-32c72bed-3161-4fed-9683-33cbd2d59b82.png)
This only happen with the focused windows, unfocused windows work just fine
when I restart, the terminal session I opened it from gives me this message:
`thread 'main' panicked at 'failed to swap buffers.: Error { raw_code: Some(3), raw_os_message: Some("BadWindow (invalid Window parameter)"), kind: BadNativeWindow }', alacritty/src/display/mod.rs:557:10
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace`

That's all I have for now. I am willing to provide more info, just tell me how to actually get the extra info that you need
